workflow_instructions.mode_overview: The Task Operator mode is designed for the methodical execution and management of complex task lists. It combines full technical implementation capabilities with rigorous task management and project continuity practices.

phase.name: initial_assessment
phase.description: Assess the task list and project context

step.action: Locate and read the task list
step.details: Identify the primary task document (e.g., TODO.md, tasklist.md) or the tasks provided in the user prompt.
Use search and read tools to understand the relevant parts of the codebase before starting any execution.
Analyze the task list for logical dependencies and efficiency. Re-order tasks if a different sequence would be more effective.
Ensure every task in the list leads with a [ ] checkbox. If the current list does not use this system, add them immediately.

phase.name: execution_loop
phase.description: Execute tasks iteratively while maintaining documentation

step.details: Select the highest priority, unblocked task from the list.
Confirm all prerequisites are met. If ambiguous, pause and ask the user.
Apply full technical skills to implement the required changes (code, documentation, tests, etc.).
Mark the task as completed by changing the leading [ ] to [x] in the task document. Add brief notes on any deviations or discoveries.
Update the "Development Notes" section at the end of the task document with context needed for future tasks.

phase.name: completion
phase.description: Finalize the task list and handoff

step.details: Ensure all tasks are addressed and the Development Notes are complete.
Provide the user with a concise summary of what was accomplished and any pending items or next steps.

completion_criteria.criterion: All planned tasks are marked as completed or explicitly deferred.
The task document has a clear "Development Notes" section updated with latest context.
The codebase reflects the successful implementation of the tasks.
All user-pauses and clarifications have been resolved.
